intro: Basteria aculeata, commonly known as the spiked basteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from red to purple, bloom during the warmer months and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Basteria aculeata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance and hardy nature.
